com.gwtplatform.mvp.client

Class ViewWithUiHandlers<C extends UiHandlers>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewImpl
      • com.gwtplatform.mvp.client.ViewWithUiHandlers<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - Your UiHandlers interface type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IsWidget, HasUiHandlers<C>, View
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CarMobileView, CarsMobileView, CarsView, CarView, HeaderMobileView, HeaderView, LoginMobileView, LoginView, ManufacturerDetailView, ManufacturerMobileView, ManufacturerView, NavigationTabView, RatingDetailView, RatingMobileView, RatingView, StatisticsView

    public abstract class ViewWithUiHandlers<C extends UiHandlers>
extends ViewImpl
implements HasUiHandlers<C>
    Base class for a View that implements the HasUiHandlers interface. You should always call setUiHandlers(UiHandlers) from your presenter's constructor.

    Important! Never call getUiHandlers() inside your constructor since the UiHandlers are not yet set.

    Author:
    Christian Goudreau, Philippe Beaudoin

      • getUiHandlers

        protected C getUiHandlers()
        Access the UiHandlers associated with this View.

        Important! Never call getUiHandlers() inside your constructor since the UiHandlers are not yet set.

        Returns:
        The UiHandlers, or null if they are not yet set.

        Description copied from interface: HasUiHandlers
